SEARCH
Module io.github.ascopes.jct
Package io.github.ascopes.jct.compilers

Interface JctCompiler<C extends JctCompiler<C,R>,R extends JctCompilation>

Type Parameters:
C - the implementation type. This is provided to allow call-chaining the implementation.
R - the compilation type that gets returned once compilation completes.
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractJctCompiler, JavacJctCompilerImpl
@API(since="0.0.1", status=EXPERIMENTAL) public interface JctCompiler<C extends JctCompiler<C,R>,R extends JctCompilation>
Base definition of a compiler that can be configured to perform a compilation run against sources. This is designed to provide functionality that javac does by default, for JDK 17.
Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Ashley Scopes

    • DEFAULT_LOG_CHARSET

      static final Charset DEFAULT_LOG_CHARSET
      Default charset to use for compiler logs (StandardCharsets.UTF_8).

    • DEFAULT_TEST_DIRECTORY_FACTORY

      static final TestDirectoryFactory DEFAULT_TEST_DIRECTORY_FACTORY
      Default setting for creating temporary directories for use during compilation.

      The default is to use a RAM disk, but this can be swapped out with a temporary directory on the root file system if desired, or a custom implementation can be used.

  • Method Details

    • configure

      <E extends Exception> C configure(JctCompilerConfigurer<E> configurer) throws E
      Apply a given configurer to this compiler that can throw a checked exception.
      Type Parameters:
      E - any exception that may be thrown.
      Parameters:
      configurer - the configurer to invoke.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.
      Throws:
      E - any exception that may be thrown by the configurer.

    • addPath

      C addPath(JavaFileManager.Location location, PathWrapper pathLike)
      Add a path-like object to a given location.

      The location must not be module-oriented.

      The path can be one of:

      • A path to a directory containing a package;
      • A path to a JAR containing a package or module;
      • A path to a WAR containing a package or module; or
      • A path to a ZIP containing a package or module.
      Parameters:
      location - the location to add.
      pathLike - the path-like object to add.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the location is module-oriented or an JavaFileManager.Location.isOutputLocation() output location}.

    • addPath

      default C addPath(JavaFileManager.Location location, Path path)
      Add a NIO Path object to a given location.

      The location must not be module-oriented.

      The path can be one of:

      • A path to a directory containing a package;
      • A path to a JAR containing a package or module;
      • A path to a WAR containing a package or module; or
      • A path to a ZIP containing a package or module.
      Parameters:
      location - the location to add.
      path - the path to add.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the location is not module-oriented.

    • addPath

      C addPath(JavaFileManager.Location location, String moduleName, PathWrapper pathLike)
      Add a path-like object within a module to a given location.

      The location must be module-oriented.

      The path can be one of:

      • A path to a directory containing a package;
      • A path to a JAR containing a package or module;
      • A path to a WAR containing a package or module; or
      • A path to a ZIP containing a package or module.
      Parameters:
      location - the location to add.
      pathLike - the path-like object to add.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the location is not module-oriented.

    • addPath

      default C addPath(JavaFileManager.Location location, String moduleName, Path path)

    • addClassPath

      default C addClassPath(PathWrapper pathLike)
      Add a path-like object that contains a package to the class path.

      The path can be one of:

      • A path to a directory containing a package;
      • A path to a JAR containing a package or module;
      • A path to a WAR containing a package or module; or
      • A path to a ZIP containing a package or module.

      Note: to add modules, consider using addModulePath(String, PathWrapper) instead.

      Parameters:
      pathLike - the path-like object to add.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • addClassPath

      default C addClassPath(Path path)
      Add a NIO Path that contains a package to the class path.

      The path can be one of:

      • A path to a directory containing a package;
      • A path to a JAR containing a package or module;
      • A path to a WAR containing a package or module; or
      • A path to a ZIP containing a package or module.

      Note: to add modules, consider using addModulePath(String, Path) instead.

      Parameters:
      path - the path to add.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • addModulePath

      default C addModulePath(String moduleName, PathWrapper pathLike)
      Add a path-like object that contains a module package to the module path.

      The path can be one of:

      • A path to a directory containing a package;
      • A path to a JAR containing a package or module;
      • A path to a WAR containing a package or module; or
      • A path to a ZIP containing a package or module.

      Note: to add regular packages, consider using addClassPath(PathWrapper) instead.

      Parameters:
      moduleName - the name of the module.
      pathLike - the path-like object to add.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • addModulePath

      default C addModulePath(String moduleName, Path path)
      Add a NIO Path that contains a module package to the module path.

      The path can be one of:

      • A path to a directory containing a package;
      • A path to a JAR containing a package or module;
      • A path to a WAR containing a package or module; or
      • A path to a ZIP containing a package or module.

      Note: to add regular packages, consider using addClassPath(Path) instead.

      Parameters:
      moduleName - the name of the module.
      path - the path to add.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • addSourcePath

      default C addSourcePath(PathWrapper pathLike)
      Add a path-like object that contains a package to the source path.

      Anything placed in here will be treated as a compilation unit by default.

      The path can be one of:

      • A path to a directory containing a package;
      • A path to a JAR containing a package or module;
      • A path to a WAR containing a package or module; or
      • A path to a ZIP containing a package or module.

      Note: to add modules, consider using addModuleSourcePath(String, PathWrapper) instead. You will not be able to mix this method and that method together.

      Parameters:
      pathLike - the path-like object to add.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • addSourcePath

      default C addSourcePath(Path path)
      Add a NIO Path that contains a package to the class path.

      Anything placed in here will be treated as a compilation unit by default.

      The path can be one of:

      • A path to a directory containing a package;
      • A path to a JAR containing a package or module;
      • A path to a WAR containing a package or module; or
      • A path to a ZIP containing a package or module.

      Note: to add modules, consider using addModuleSourcePath(String, PathWrapper) instead. You will not be able to mix this method and that method together.

      Parameters:
      path - the path to add.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • addModuleSourcePath

      default C addModuleSourcePath(String moduleName, PathWrapper pathLike)
      Add a path-like object that contains a module package to the source path.

      Anything placed in here will be treated as a compilation unit by default.

      The path can be one of:

      • A path to a directory containing a package;
      • A path to a JAR containing a package or module;
      • A path to a WAR containing a package or module; or
      • A path to a ZIP containing a package or module.

      Note: to add non-modules, consider using addSourcePath(PathWrapper) instead. You will not be able to mix this method and that method together.

      Parameters:
      moduleName - the name of the module to add.
      pathLike - the path-like object to add.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • addModuleSourcePath

      default C addModuleSourcePath(String moduleName, Path path)
      Add a NIO Path that contains a module package to the class path.

      Anything placed in here will be treated as a compilation unit by default.

      The path can be one of:

      • A path to a directory containing a package;
      • A path to a JAR containing a package or module;
      • A path to a WAR containing a package or module; or
      • A path to a ZIP containing a package or module.

      Note: to add non-modules, consider using addSourcePath(Path) instead. You will not be able to mix this method and that method together.

      Parameters:
      moduleName - the name of the module to add.
      path - the path to add.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • addAnnotationProcessorPath

      default C addAnnotationProcessorPath(PathWrapper pathLike)
      Add a path-like object that contains a package to compiled annotation processors.

      This will be used for annotation processor discovery.

      The path can be one of:

      • A path to a directory containing a package;
      • A path to a JAR containing a package or module;
      • A path to a WAR containing a package or module; or
      • A path to a ZIP containing a package or module.
      Parameters:
      pathLike - the path-like object to add.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • addAnnotationProcessors

      C addAnnotationProcessors(Iterable<? extends Processor> annotationProcessors)
      Add annotation processors to invoke.

      This bypasses the discovery process of annotation processors provided in addAnnotationProcessorPath(io.github.ascopes.jct.pathwrappers.PathWrapper).

      Parameters:
      annotationProcessors - the processors to invoke.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • addAnnotationProcessors

      default C addAnnotationProcessors(Processor annotationProcessor, Processor... annotationProcessors)
      Add annotation processors to invoke.

      This bypasses the discovery process of annotation processors provided in addAnnotationProcessorPath(io.github.ascopes.jct.pathwrappers.PathWrapper).

      Parameters:
      annotationProcessor - the first processor to invoke.
      annotationProcessors - additional processors to invoke.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • getCompilerOptions

      List<String> getCompilerOptions()
      Get an immutable snapshot view of the current compiler options that are set.
      Returns:
      the current compiler options that are set.

      Add command line options to pass to javac.
      Parameters:
      compilerOptions - the options to add.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • addCompilerOptions

      default C addCompilerOptions(String compilerOption, String... compilerOptions)
      Add command line options to pass to javac.
      Parameters:
      compilerOption - the first option to add.
      compilerOptions - additional options to add.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • getRuntimeOptions

      List<String> getRuntimeOptions()
      Get an immutable snapshot view of the current runtime options that are set.
      Returns:
      the current runtime options that are set.

    • addRuntimeOptions

      C addRuntimeOptions(Iterable<String> runtimeOptions)
      Add options to pass to the Java runtime.
      Parameters:
      runtimeOptions - the options to pass to the runtime.
      Returns:
      this compiler for further call chaining.

    • addRuntimeOptions

      default C addRuntimeOptions(String runtimeOption, String... runtimeOptions)
      Add options to pass to the Java runtime.
      Parameters:
      runtimeOption - the first option to pass to the runtime.
      runtimeOptions - additional options to pass to the runtime.

      this compiler for further call chaining.

    • isVerbose

      boolean isVerbose()
      Determine whether verbose logging is enabled or not.

      Unless otherwise changed or specified, implementations should default to DEFAULT_VERBOSE.

      Note that enabling this is compiler-specific behaviour. There is no guarantee that the output target or the format or verbosity of output will be consistent between different compiler implementations.

      Returns:
      whether verbose logging is enabled or not.

    • verbose

      C verbose(boolean enabled)
      Set whether to use verbose output or not.

      Unless otherwise changed or specified, implementations should default to DEFAULT_VERBOSE.

      Note that enabling this is compiler-specific behaviour. There is no guarantee that the output target or the format or verbosity of output will be consistent between different compiler implementations.

      Parameters:
      enabled - true for verbose output, false for normal output.
      Returns:
      this compiler for further call chaining.

    • getRelease

      @Nullable String getRelease()
      Get the current release version that is set, or null if left to the compiler to decide. default.

      Unless explicitly defined, the default setting is expected to be a sane compiler-specific default.

      Returns:
      the release version string, if set.

    • isFixJvmModulePathMismatch

      boolean isFixJvmModulePathMismatch()
      Get whether we will attempt to fix modules appearing on the classpath, or non-modules appearing on the module path.

      This enables correct classpath and module path detection when the test pack is a module but the code being compiled in the test is not, and vice versa. We need this because many build systems decide whether to populate the --module-path flat or the --classpath with JPMS-enabled dependencies based on whether the project under compilation is a JPMS module itself.

      This only applies if isInheritModulePath() or isInheritClassPath() is enabled, and only applies to the current JVM classpath and module path.

      Unless otherwise changed or specified, implementations should default to DEFAULT_FIX_JVM_MODULEPATH_MISMATCH.

      Returns:
      true if enabled, or false if disabled.

    • fixJvmModulePathMismatch

      C fixJvmModulePathMismatch(boolean fixJvmModulePathMismatch)
      Get whether we will attempt to fix modules appearing on the classpath, or non-modules appearing on the module path.

      Unless otherwise changed or specified, implementations should default to DEFAULT_FIX_JVM_MODULEPATH_MISMATCH.

      Parameters:
      fixJvmModulePathMismatch - whether to enable the mismatch fixing or not.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • isInheritClassPath

      boolean isInheritClassPath()
      Get whether the class path is inherited from the caller JVM or not.

      Unless otherwise changed or specified, implementations should default to DEFAULT_INHERIT_CLASS_PATH.

      Returns:
      whether the current class path is being inherited or not.

    • isInheritPlatformClassPath

      boolean isInheritPlatformClassPath()
      Get whether the current platform class path is being inherited from the caller JVM or not.

      This may also be known as the "bootstrap class path".

      Default environments probably will not provide this functionality, in which case it will be ignored.

      Unless otherwise changed or specified, implementations should default to DEFAULT_INHERIT_PLATFORM_CLASS_PATH.

      Returns:
      whether the platform class path is being inherited or not.

    • inheritPlatformClassPath

      C inheritPlatformClassPath(boolean inheritPlatformClassPath)

      This may also be known as the "bootstrap class path".

      Default environments probably will not provide this functionality, in which case it will be ignored.

      Parameters:
      inheritPlatformClassPath - true to include it, or false to exclude it.
      Returns:
      this compiler object for further call chaining.

    • getAnnotationProcessorDiscovery

      AnnotationProcessorDiscovery getAnnotationProcessorDiscovery()
      Get how to perform annotation processor discovery.

      Unless otherwise changed or specified, implementations should default to DEFAULT_ANNOTATION_PROCESSOR_DISCOVERY.

      Specifying any annotation processors explicitly with addAnnotationProcessors(Iterable) or addAnnotationProcessors(Processor, Processor...) will bypass this setting, treating it as being disabled.

      Returns:
      the processor discovery mode to use.

    • annotationProcessorDiscovery

      C annotationProcessorDiscovery(AnnotationProcessorDiscovery annotationProcessorDiscovery)

      Unless otherwise changed or specified, implementations should default to DEFAULT_ANNOTATION_PROCESSOR_DISCOVERY.

      Specifying any annotation processors explicitly with addAnnotationProcessors(Iterable) or addAnnotationProcessors(Processor, Processor...) will bypass this setting, treating it as being disabled.

      Parameters:
      annotationProcessorDiscovery - the processor discovery mode to use.
      Returns:
      this compiler for further call chaining.

    • compile

      R compile()
      Invoke the compilation and return the compilation result.
      Returns:
      the compilation result.
      Throws:
      JctCompilerException - if the compiler threw an unhandled exception. This should not occur for compilation failures generally.
      IllegalStateException - if no compilation units were found.
      UncheckedIOException - if an IO error occurs.
